info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 8:02PM EDT until July 29 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following counties, Buncombe, Henderson and Transylvania.
* WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 802 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arden, West Asheville, Mills River, Fletcher, Etowah, Mountain Home, Biltmore Forest, Bent Creek, Asheville Airport, B.R. Parkway-Mount Pisgah To The Nc Arboretum, Biltmore Park, Skyland, B.R. Parkway-Nc Arboretum To East Asheville, Avery Creek, Forge Mountain, Horse Shoe, North Transylvania and Penrose. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via X using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
